TopicTitle: The unofficially official 0.24-Kerbapalooza Thread - Now extra #HYPETRAIN!

Articles.Content:
The things one does when getting bored, waiting for the patch...

Squad, release 0.24 now! Or these 99 Kerbals are going to get smashed by the MKKM (mass kerbal killing machine)...

I'm not kidding!

The things one does when getting bored, waiting for the patch...

Squad, release 0.24 now! Or these 99 Kerbals are going to get smashed by the MKKM (mass kerbal killing machine)...

http://i.imgur.com/Ig6pxAx.jpg

I'm not kidding!

http://i.imgur.com/ArWynCL.jpg

You fail to realize that Danny2462 already has 0.24. Anything you could do pales in comparison.
HYPE!!!
I guess that could be released the 16th or the 20th to celebrate Apollo 11 mission 40 years anniversary.
Oh myyyy....

THE WHAT???? 64 bits like half the normal size!!!!

SWEET!!

I hope this dosent blow mods minds in to a billion rep points

I said sweat.....not sweet:(
Also damnit. I want 0.24 now. I bet either thursday or friday.

THE WHAT???? 64 bits like half the normal size!!!!

SWEAT!!

I hope this dosent blow mods minds in to a billion rep points

Almost certainly, that 753 MB will be in ADDITION to the base 32bit game.

Also damnit. I want 0.24 now. I bet either thursday or friday.

Won't be on a Friday, I would bet. They did a Friday release once that had a few tough bugs, made for a busy weekend for them when they were already burnt out from the push to release.

Also damnit. I want 0.24 now. I bet either thursday or friday.

You wash you mouth out!
So how do we change our steam versions to the 64bit? (when 0.24 is out)

Almost certainly, that 753 MB will be in ADDITION to the base 32bit game.

HMMM i don't think that's how the downloads at the KSP site work......could be but I doubt it..

This should demolish lag like miley sirus on three wrecking balls......(he he lol)

Almost certainly, that 753 MB will be in ADDITION to the base 32bit game.

I doubt it. After all, linux has a 64 bit executable which isn't that much larger. IIRC, it's actually packaged in the same download as 32 bit and the user chooses which to launch.

My guess is, since 64 bit isn't the priority or the main dev branch, it's a stripped-down version for testing, and the full version will be identical to 32- bit except for the executable and a few assorted other files.

But that's only a guess, and I could be totally wrong.

You wash you mouth out!

Noope. I had enought of soap thanks.

So how do we change our steam versions to the 64bit? (when 0.24 is out)

I guess it'll either auto-detect that you have a 64 bit system, or give you an option to use 64 bit on launch. Other games do that.

Not everything needs to be redownloaded for x64. Most of content will be shared, so it will be 750MB + the classic 32-bits install.

(edit: I admit 750MB just for some binaries is quite large, we'll se Soon enough anyway).

Edited July 15, 2014 by Lilleman

I dont know ksp but,other 64bit games uses same folders and files,Not different files for different architecture. They just have two executable in same folder.

Like battlefield 4.

KSP on linux works the same way. I don't see where 750 extra MB on windows 64 bit would come from.
